lenders.name: Anqi
lenders.loan_because: You can give a man a fish, or you can teach him how to fish. I believe in the power of small business run by the individual, for the individual, not only to build a sustainable living, but also to stimulate an entire community's economy. I want to share what I have with those who need and deserve it the most.
lenders.occupational_info: By training, I am an electrical engineer, but currently I am pursuing graduate studies in business economics. I study how market transactions occur and recommend government policies to improve the way goods are distributed. Eventually, I hope to start my own business. In my free time, I love to read, write stories, and draw.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the idea that every man and woman should have the chance to prosper.
lenders.occupational_info: I deal with the design and construction of the physical environment.

lenders.name: Derek
lenders.loan_because: I want to see people do well

lenders.name: Ellie
lenders.loan_because: I believe in microfinance: it brings poor people out of a key expolitative cycle often involving powerful local moneylenders. It empowers people and supports self-determination. It starts off small and becomes bigger.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with Australian Indigenous and non-Indigenous people on land issues, and land use and land management planning by groups, communities  and individuals; supporting sustainable economies, empowering local people.

lenders.name: Gleyenna
lenders.loan_because: I get great pleasure seeing people (specially family and friends) succeed in their craft or profession.

lenders.name: Kaelyn Forde
lenders.loan_because: My experience within Asian and Latin American developing nations has been that poverty and the despair it creates are endless until a functioning civil society can be established. The chronically undernourished, the illiterate and the ethnically marginalized cannot build economic, civil and democratic institutions. A strong, efficacious middle class has historically demanded the environmental, educational, political, economic, civil and judicial reforms that many countries so desperately need. It develops human capital, empowers women and families and sustains entire communities. I first became interested in micro-finance while working as a correspondent in Cambodia; I saw land mine amputees and Khmer Rouge veterans regain their dignity and independence by selling books rather than begging.
lenders.occupational_info: I aspire to work as a trilingual foreign correspondent in Latin America for an international television news network. I will also write, shoot, edit and produce a documentary accompaniment to my honors thesis, coalescing my dual degrees in Broadcast Journalism and International Relations. I believe film brings us closer than words can.

lenders.name: Teo and Melissa
lenders.loan_because: We are making a personal investment to help enrich people's lives and eliminate poverty.

lenders.name: Matt
lenders.loan_because: To share the resources I've been given.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: local knowledge is important and should be supported over foreign development campaigns.
lenders.occupational_info: I support and facilitate coalitions finding community assets that can change their health and well-being.

lenders.name: Elisabeth
lenders.loan_because:
I loan because everyone deserves to be able to make a living, and if that means me or other people having to help them out a bit, well then I'll do it. The point in life to enjoy yourself, and when you don't have money in a world that revolves around money, then people with enough should help those who don't have enough enjoy their life. You only have one life so you better enjoy it while you can!
                         -Elisabeth
lenders.occupational_info: I am a novelist. Nothing has been published yet, but I'm still working toward my goal; to publish a novel.

lenders.name: Jeri B
lenders.occupational_info: I help adults learn to read, write, use numbers, and use computers.

lenders.name: George
lenders.loan_because: Just like these folks, I also needed help to start in business. What a great opportunity to do the same for others!
lenders.occupational_info: Businessman & promoter of the arts.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: If I'm honest, because I don't do much in the way of helping others. So it's about time eh...
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a company who manufacture sand paper, you may have come across it if you've ever worked with wood or metal. It's used to prepare, clean or smoothen surfaces. It's not rocket science but it's a good job which has seen me travel to some interesting places.

lenders.name: Erica
lenders.loan_because: I believe that asking for what you need is brave and needs as much support as I can give it.
lenders.occupational_info: I hire people to work for a great company and listen to there concerns so that it is easier for them to focus on work.

lenders.name: Sand
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those who want to start environmentally friend businesses, such as recycling or eco-tours, it's definately the way of the future!

lenders.name: Beth
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do
lenders.occupational_info: loves to sing

lenders.name: catalyst
lenders.loan_because: we are a developing business and would like to assist entrepreneurs in other parts of the world establish themselves and build a better lifestyle for their families
lenders.occupational_info: we provide services to financial services businesses in australia

lenders.name: Glenn
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others help themselves. I wish everyone in the world could live more simply so that everyone could have the basics that so many of us take for granted.

lenders.name: Bert & Saskia
lenders.loan_because: To support people in making a better living

lenders.name: Jean
lenders.loan_because: I am very fortunate to have a wonderful family and live a great life. To have the opportunity to help others reach for their dreams gives me a great sense of self fulfillment.
lenders.occupational_info: I use my talents and resources in the technology sector to make Africa a better place to live and work for all Africans.

lenders.name: Corinne

lenders.occupational_info: I am a self-employed medical biller, and this year we adopted our 2yo daughter from Ethiopia.

lenders.occupational_info: I go to many different schools to teach children how to express themselves. My wife teaches those who have problems learning.

lenders.occupational_info: I help others to find their voice and share their voice both therapeutically as a Speech Language Pathologist as well as a poet and as a Life Coach.

lenders.loan_because: I want to help.

lenders.name: Susie, Encinitas, CA USA
lenders.occupation: Event Manager for an educational non-profit
lenders.occupational_info:
Our company trains teachers to help students get to college. Many of these students will be the first in their families to attend college.
I plan the trainings. We meet in 8 cities each summer and train about 2,000 educators in each city.  It's a lot of work but fun and rewarding!

lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me with sufficient money so I want to share it with others.  I think loaning money through Kiva is a great way encourage small families in 3rd world countries to support themselves.  I visited Cambodia and have a particular love for the people of this country and want to help in any way I can.

lenders.name: Jenifer

This is my small contribution to counteract the disproportionate injustice and suffering in the world... 
From those to whom much is given...much is expected.

lenders.name: Mark

lenders.name: Sue
lenders.occupation: better world scout & CBC radio tech columnist
lenders.loan_because: I believe that planting many seeds of uplift in small and meaningful ways produces sustainable community harvests. Micro-lending is the most direct and personal form of uplift and has the capacity for constant renewal.
lenders.occupational_info: Community technology strategist and radio columnist by day, better world scout by heart.    I'm a connector and bridge builder with two willing hands.

lenders.name: Bandegolus/DRRGLPAD

lenders.name: Sue Braiden
lenders.loan_because:
I want to give people a chance to become self-sufficient and live an honourable life.

I believe that a hand up is better than a hand out, and that it needs to be both transparent and accountable.

I believe that planting many seeds of uplift in small and meaningful ways helps people become self-sustaining and strengthens both the economic and social fabric of communities. Micro-lending is the most direct and personal form of uplift and has the capacity for constant renewal.
lenders.occupational_info:
This started out as a personal account in which I invested a percentage of my sales income into people through microloans through a few online projects.  

In 2008 I began inviting customers and friends to join me in creating a little uplift here at Kiva, which resulted in investing in the first 50 entrepreneurs during the first year.  

Since that time the money has been reinvested to support more than 300 entrepreneurs.  I continue to invite people to join me in creating a little uplift in these lives through our "Giving Tree" group (link at the bottom of this page).

Namaste,
Sue.

lenders.name: Schultz
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy contributing to someone's dream of owning/operating their own business. It's all about helping each other at the end of the day....
lenders.occupational_info: Risk mitigation/crisis management for a financial institution. I also run a small business on Ebay selling handbags and other accessories.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: I can.  In the last year, I've had the opportunity to travel to various places in Southeast Asia.  I've seen so much beauty in all the countries I've been to but I've also seen so much poverty.  Its hard to just be a tourist and not make more of a difference to the people living there.  I ask myself...is there anything I can do besides being a tourist in these places?  Is there something I can do even if I only have little money to offer.  I'm hopeful that this is part of the answer :-)

lenders.name: Gar
lenders.loan_because: Luck played a large part in me being able to live as I do. Talent and ambition should be encouraged and nourished regardless of circumstance.

lenders.name: TheBikeLife
lenders.loan_because:
"We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand." - Randy Pausch...


Bettering the standard of living - especially in DVC's -  fundamentally rests on productivity gains via improvements to physical capital, better methodologies and technologies, or investments into human capital such as education.  Yet, it's often a catch-22 for those living in poverty:  To improve financial well-being one must make these investments, but to establish these investments one must have the financing.


While avoiding many of the debilitating complexities of foreign aid, Kiva establishes a market for microfinancing to prosper and provides the resources vital for rising out of dire poverty.  These loans create the opportunity for individuals to work hard and fund the investments they truly need for long-term gains - for their family, for their community, and for their country.  More often than not, they are good people that simply need an opportunity to thrive...

"We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand."  It only takes a little from us to greatly change these entrepreneurs' lives.  Let's step up and lend, and help them play the best hand of their lives!

lenders.name: JD B
lenders.loan_because: I am inspired by the stories and hard work of people all over the world trying to make a better life for their families.
lenders.occupational_info:
I help to identify and recognize those microfinance programs that are proving the most effective in fighting poverty. 
Twitter @jdbergeron

lenders.occupational_info: Business Owner:  Skin Care and Wellness

lenders.loan_because: Of the age old cliche, everybody deserves a chance.
lenders.occupational_info: We mold the minds of the young.

lenders.name: Sharon
lenders.loan_because: To applaud their efforts and show that am cheering for their success.

lenders.name: Stewby
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who may not have the opportunity to get out of poverty were it not for microcredit, and because I live in a hugely privileged part of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in educational video as well as making short films.  I am also a photographer, with a particular interest in live music photography.

lenders.name: InSite Yoga
lenders.loan_because: Our mission is to help individuals and communities progress toward the fullest expression of their potential. Lending through Kiva is one way in which can fulfill our purpose and extend our support to entrepreneurs and organizations around the world. It is also one of the ways we take our yoga practice 'off the mat and into the world'. So, in the spirit of generosity, compassion, and inner freedom we are thrilled to be a part of the Kiva community and give loans that change lives.
lenders.occupational_info: InSite Yoga is a mobile wellness company that develops educational programs and services that help individuals and communities access the well-documented benefits of yoga and progress toward the fullest expression of their potential.

lenders.name: Mark & Miya
lenders.loan_because: it helps to improve lives, and inspires others to do so also. This is a great place to start. Thanks goes to Kiva, and all within it for reaching out to those in need. The world needs viable, sustainable and equitable solutions to complex environmental and development challenges. Whether you work for a non-profit, in a business, in education, in law or become an entrepreneur, you can use your skills, knowledge and experience to build a better world. With such a perspective, we can create positive change in overseas communities where there are issues of economic inequality, social injustice, and environmental degradation. We can find out what we are passionate about and act on it in a way that is effective, sustainable, and responsible.
lenders.occupational_info: > MARK is a financial trader, and financial risk management consultant, assisting others to clarify, simplify and work with more focus in their trading. ...............................  > MIYA works in a community-based organization, helping poor children and their families to work to achieve transformational development. ..............................

lenders.name: Thierry
lenders.loan_because:
I wholeheartedly believe in the principles behind micro-finance and Kiva. 

People are fundamentally well intentioned and able. It's often the situation and context in which they live that impacts their ability to lead a fulfilling life and reach their dreams. Lending through Kiva, levels the playing field.

People get satisfaction in achieving their goals and meeting their own needs and Kiva certainly helps in that regard. But I also think Kiva helps the more fortunate ones among us get perspective and by making it easy for us to help out, makes us feel good too. 

I loan because helping someone in need makes me feel good.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people start companies and come-up with ways to sell their products.

lenders.name: Jeni
lenders.loan_because: I want to empower others

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I've been fortunate in my life, with others helping me in my studies and profession. I would like to return the favor to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I help children and grownups with worries that they don't understand and which make it difficult for them to enjoy their lives.
